thread.title: Spurned bride gifts wedding feast to Sacramento's homeless
thread.title_full: Spurned bride gifts wedding feast to Sacramento's homeless - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Spurned bride gifts wedding feast to Sacramento's homeless
text:
KTLA The bride's family gave up their wedding food after the groom got cold feet and called the whole thing off. A jilted bride put her wedding feast to good use feeding Sacramento’s homeless, according to a local report.
The salmon and tri-tip would have fed 120 friends and family of Kari Duane’s daughter, Quinn, but it instead went to strangers.
The new guests included couples and families with children, all of whom took advantage of the groom’s cold feet that left Duane’s daughter without her dream $35,000 wedding on Saturday, KCRA-TV reported .
KTLA The bride's mother, Kari Duane, decided to give back after her daughter's fiance got cold feet. KTLA The jilted bride did not attend her wedding feast donated to Sacramento's homeless over the weekend at the Citizen Hotel. Previous Next Enlarge “When I found out on Monday that the wedding would not be taking place,” Duane told the TV station. “This would be something that we would do to give back.”
The catering was equivalent to the four-star restaurant at the city’s posh Citizen Hotel, where video shows a line of the city’s underserved residents snaking around serving tables.
Erika Craycraft, her husband, Rashad Abdullah, and their five children, were among those filling their stomachs with something nicer than what is found at local shelters.
“I think it’s really generous to lose out on something so important to yourself and then give it to someone else is really giving,” Craycraft told the TV station.
The bride stayed home instead of attending Saturday’s dinner. Before tackling mounting bills tied to the wedding, Duane and her daughter will take off to Belize with those honeymoon tickets and reservations.
nhensley@nydailynews.com
